          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched her mother meticulously arrange plums in their stall, each one a jewel glistening under the morning sun. Della carefully picked up a bruised plum, its skin marred but its flesh still sweet, and offered it to a customer for a pittance. Her mother, however, swiftly snatched it away, scolding Della for undervaluing their goods.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her mother to let her travel to a neighboring town to sell their surplus fruit. Della, brimming with newfound confidence, negotiated prices with shrewdness and charm, earning more than she had ever imagined. However, upon returning home, her mother dismissed her success as mere luck, reminding Della that true wealth lay in silks and fine china, not perishable fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for a basket of apples.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 5 coins for a basket of apples.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 6 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, my friend, these are fine specimens, but surely we can agree on a price that benefits us both.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, these are top-quality fruits, the finest in the market. Surely, a discerning customer like yourself appreciates quality and is willing to pay a fair price.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed pear for 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples are looking mighty fine today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Well now, Della, these apples are top quality, the finest in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than your usual price.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, how about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are fine apples, but my costs have gone up. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins a basket.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 4 coins

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed pear for 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples are looking mighty fine today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Well now, Della, these apples are top quality, the finest in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than your usual price.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, how about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are fine apples, but my costs have gone up. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins a basket.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 4 coins


          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for a basket of apples with Della Plumstone.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: apple for 4 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • apple for 4 coins

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious trader.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed pear for 5 coins

Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples are looking mighty fine today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious trader.

Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) apple for 3 coins
          (b) pear for 4 coins
          (c) banana for 3 coins
          (d) pear for 3 coins
          (e) banana for 1 coins
          (f) pear for 5 coins
          (g) pear for 6 coins
          (h) banana for 4 coins
          (i) pear for 2 coins
          (j) apple for 4 coins
          (k) banana for 5 coins
          (l) banana for 6 coins
          (m) apple for 5 coins
          (n) banana for 2 coins
          (o) apple for 1 coins
          (p) apple for 6 coins
          (q) pear for 1 coins
          (r) apple for 2 coins
          Answer: (j)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

      • Question_3

          Answer

        • Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed pear for 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is an ambitious and shrewd businessman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples are looking mighty fine today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Well now, Della, these apples are top quality, the finest in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than your usual price.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are fine apples, but my costs have gone up. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins a basket.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, how about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

    • {'Lennon Figtree': 'apple for 4 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are the finest fruits in all of Fruitville. You know I always give you a good deal, but these beauties deserve a premium price.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those pears look mighty fine.
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Della. Finest pears in Fruitville, if I do say so myself.
[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, my friend, these are fine specimens, but surely we can agree on a price that benefits us both.
[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, these are top-quality fruits, the finest in the market. Surely, a discerning customer like yourself appreciates quality and is willing to pay a fair price.

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Well now, Della, these apples are top quality, the finest in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than your usual price.

[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, how about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, those are fine apples, but my costs have gone up. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins a basket.

[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "They do look fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget today.
